## üìä RISK SCORING METHODOLOGY

<div style="background: #E7F3FF; padding: 20px; border-left: 4px solid #145B8B; margin: 20px 0;">

### FMEA Scoring System

**Risk Priority Number (RPN) = Severity √ó Occurrence √ó Detection**

**RPN Ranges:**
- **üî¥ 200-1000:** Critical - Immediate action required
- **üü° 125-199:** High - Action plan required  
- **üü¢ 40-124:** Medium - Monitor and improve
- **‚ö™ 1-39:** Low - Acceptable risk

</div>

### Severity (S) - Impact if risk occurs

<div style="background: white; padding: 20px; border: 2px solid #ddd; border-radius: 8px; margin: 20px 0;">

| Score | Rating | Description | Examples |
|:---:|:---|:---|:---|
| **10** | Catastrophic | Safety hazard, major HUD Code violation | Structural failure, electrical fire risk |
| **9** | Serious | NTA TPIA rejection, recall required | Critical HUD non-compliance |
| **8** | Major | Significant quality issue, customer complaint | Major rework, warranty claim |
| **7** | Moderate-High | Process disruption, minor HUD issue | Production delay, minor compliance gap |
| **6** | Moderate | Quality defect detected internally | Rework required, caught at inspection |
| **5** | Low-Moderate | Minor quality issue | Cosmetic defect, minor adjustment |
| **4** | Minor | Slight inconvenience | Documentation error |
| **3** | Very Minor | Negligible impact | Process inefficiency |
| **2** | Insignificant | Minimal effect | Minor paperwork issue |
| **1** | None | No impact | Theoretical risk only |

</div>

### Occurrence (O) - Likelihood of risk occurring

<div style="background: white; padding: 20px; border: 2px solid #ddd; border-radius: 8px; margin: 20px 0;">

| Score | Rating | Probability | Frequency |
|:---:|:---|:---|:---|
| **10** | Almost Certain | ‚â•1 in 2 | More than once per week |
| **9** | Very High | 1 in 3 | Once per week |
| **8** | High | 1 in 8 | Once per month |
| **7** | Moderate-High | 1 in 20 | Once per quarter |
| **6** | Moderate | 1 in 80 | Once per year |
| **5** | Low-Moderate | 1 in 400 | Once per 2-3 years |
| **4** | Low | 1 in 2,000 | Once per 5 years |
| **3** | Very Low | 1 in 15,000 | Once per 10+ years |
| **2** | Remote | 1 in 150,000 | Rare |
| **1** | Nearly Impossible | <1 in 1,500,000 | Extremely rare |

</div>

### Detection (D) - Ability to detect before impact

<div style="background: white; padding: 20px; border: 2px solid #ddd; border-radius: 8px; margin: 20px 0;">

| Score | Rating | Detection Capability |
|:---:|:---|:---|
| **10** | Almost Impossible | No controls, defect will reach customer |
| **9** | Very Unlikely | Weak controls, likely to escape detection |
| **8** | Unlikely | Random sampling only |
| **7** | Low | Manual inspection, subjective |
| **6** | Moderate-Low | Periodic inspection, some controls |
| **5** | Moderate | Regular inspection, established controls |
| **4** | Moderate-High | Frequent inspection, good controls |
| **3** | High | Automated detection, NTA TPIA hold point |
| **2** | Very High | Error-proofing, cannot proceed if defect exists |
| **1** | Almost Certain | Defect prevented by design, impossible to occur |

</div>

| **New Risk Addition** | As needed | Ongoing | Anyone |

### Triggers for Unscheduled Review

- ‚òê Major nonconformance related to identified risk
- ‚òê NTA TPIA rejection
- ‚òê Customer complaint
- ‚òê Process change
- ‚òê New regulation/requirement
- ‚òê Near-miss incident
- ‚òê External audit finding

## üìö RISK CATEGORIES

<div style="background: #f9f9f9; padding: 20px; border: 2px solid #ddd; border-radius: 8px; margin: 20px 0;">

### Standard Risk Categories for Fort Homes

| Category | Examples |
|:---|:---|
| **Quality/Product** | Dimensional errors, material defects, workmanship |
| **Compliance/Regulatory** | HUD Code, CCR, NEC violations, NTA TPIA issues |
| **Safety** | Worker injury, product safety hazards |
| **Production** | Equipment failure, process capability, scheduling |
| **Supply Chain** | Material availability, supplier quality, delivery |
| **Financial** | Cost overruns, warranty claims, rework costs |
| **Human Resources** | Skills gaps, turnover, training inadequacy |
| **Environmental** | Weather impacts, facility conditions |
| **Reputation** | Customer satisfaction, brand damage |

</div>

## üìù TEMPLATE USAGE NOTES

**Conducting Risk Assessment:**

1. **Assemble Team:** Include process owner, operators, quality, engineering
2. **Identify Risks:** Brainstorm all potential failure modes
3. **Score Each Risk:** Use consistent methodology (S, O, D)
4. **Calculate RPN:** Multiply S √ó O √ó D
5. **Prioritize:** Focus on highest RPN risks first
6. **Develop Mitigations:** Create action plans for high risks
7. **Monitor:** Track mitigation effectiveness
8. **Review Regularly:** Update scores as controls improve

**Tips:**
- Be objective in scoring
- Use historical data when available
- Consider worst-case scenarios for Severity
- Current controls affect Occurrence and Detection scores
- Document rationale for scores
- Link high risks to CAPA system if actions needed

---

*This FMEA-style risk register follows Fort Homes QMS standards for proactive risk management and prioritization of mitigation efforts.*
